book.title: Classical Comics Study Guide: Jane Eyre: Making the Classics Accessible for Teachers and Students

review.body: Graphic Novel version of the story, I find the story of Jane Eyre to be overrated

I received this book as an ARC in exchange for an honest review (Thank you!).

Now that she’s running from the pharmaceutical company that’s up to no good, Kelly needs Kyle’s help. Kyle has secrets and Kelly needs to know all the facts. Will they be able to help each other, or will Kyle’s defenses...

Title: MY ASSASSIN
Series: Middlemarch Shifter
Destination: Book 4, Stand Alone,
Author: Shelley Munro
Reviewer: Ingrid Stephanie Jordan
Genre: #Paranormal #Feline #BlackPanther #Chameleon
My Score:
Book 10 Stars
Series 100 Stars


Icelantic serious problem everytime I read the next book it's better...
this series just keeps getting better with every book. hot!
I'm not known for crying, but this book made me sob like a little baby. Never done that before.

book.title: The Barker Street Regulars (A Dog Lover's Mystery, #11)

review.body: Mildly amusing. I found the constant Holmes references irritating, and Robert & Hugh superfluous, but the story was reasonably entertaining. Holly was very slow on the uptake regarding the missing dog. I would like to know how Tracker the cat gets on, & whether Rowdy & Kimi accept her...

book.title: The Girl from Everywhere (The Girl from Everywhere, #1)

review.body:
Interesting from start to finish. I loved the adventure and the time traveling and the characters as well. I especially loved Nixie's relationship with her father. Once I got half way through the book I had to finish it. I needed to know what would happen.

Overall it was a really good read.
Every so often a book comes around and heals your soul from wounds you didn't even know you had.
Oh my, this is a toughie. Just read it, with tissues, and go hug someone you love. Thank a good person for being good while you're at it.

book.title: I'll Mature When I'm Dead: Dave Barry's Amazing Tales of Adulthood

review.body: Laugh out loud funny but will be out of date 2 years from now

Mixed feelings but waiting for book 3

This story was very sad to what happened to the dragons but during the story it was funny from how some of the things I could relate to. The ending was really not an ending more like pause and wait for book 3 to continue again type feeling. I will be looking f...
Loved it. Was a great follow up book from Crazy Rich Asians and cannot wait to see what Kevin Kwan comes up with next.

book.title: The Yellow House Mystery (The Boxcar Children, #3)

review.body: We are really enjoying this series.

So good

Could not put it down -- well written -- good twists and turns -- and very entertaining :) :) ;)
Delightful character study. Oddly a charming love story filled with suspense and a bit of gore. Hoping for a sequel.
wow! this was hot! was not expecting the ending. it will be interesting to see how this series ends.
